column4: help - i was running update-manager to upgrade from 6.06 to 6.10, but it had tons of errors for some reason (ubuntu had otherwise been running smoothly). i decided to try again by rebooting, but now my system's completely hosed - i can't start gnome, i barely figured out how to get wifi working from the cli, and i can't even start vi because of missing shared libs.
any hope of rescuing my laptop from this situation?
hmm, if you want a very reliable installation, yes
if you could fix it reliably, you wouldn't be asking how to do it, so I strongly recommend a fresh install
